title.rendered: Delhi vs Mumbai, India Women’s League 2023: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Team

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

Delhi: Meg Lanning (c), Shafali Verma, Marizanne Kapp, Jemimah Rodrigues, Alice Capsey, Jess Jonassen, Taniya Bhatia (wk), Arundhati Reddy, Shikha Pandey, Radha Yadav, Tara Norris

Mumbai: Yastika Bhatia (wk), Hayley Matthews, Nat Sciver-Brunt, Harmanpreet Kaur (c), Amelia Kerr, Pooja Vastrakar, Issy Wong, Amanjot Kaur, Humaira Kazi, Jintimani Kalita, Saika Ishaque

Pitch Report

Venue: Dr DY Patil Sports Academy, Navi Mumbai

(Based on the last three games)

1st innings average score: 196

2nd innings average score: 136

Wickets per innings: 6

Type: Good for batting

Wins

Batting 1st: 67%

Batting 2nd: 33%

Fantasy Tips of The Day

Meg Lanning has added 202 runs at 50.50 in her last five competitive T20s. She is the only player to slam consecutive fifties in the ongoing tournament.

Hayley Matthews (212 runs and seven wickets), Nat Sciver-Brunt (249 runs and four wickets), and Marizanne Kapp (93 runs and five wickets) have featured in the Best11 for five consecutive games.

In her last five competitive T20s, Harmanpreet Kaur has registered two fifties and a thirty – of which the top score of 65 came at the DY Patil Sports Academy.

Saika Ishaque is the leading wicket-taker (six) for the tournament, including the best figures of four for 11. She hasn’t gone wicketless for four consecutive T20s.

Amelia Kerr has kept fantasy players ahead in the race through her all-round skills. Besides adding 137 runs, she has taken seven wickets in her last five outings.

Shafali Verma is striking it clean and big. She is the joint-leading six-hitter (five) and has the second-highest individual score (84) in this inaugural edition.

In her only visit to DY Patil Sports Academy in this edition, Jess Jonassen was the vice-captain of the Best11 for smashing 42 off 20 and picking a three-for later in the match.

Radha Yadav has managed to strike only once with the ball in her last five T20s.
